Reviews.Content: good deal for just sleep I stayed this hotel for 4 nights. The room was fine, pretty old but nothing bothered me. If you stay there you should't pass through Lemon Street just next to Cartwrite Rd. (Especially, if you are female traveler.) There were some homeless look group every night. I didn't have good impression it. The hotel doesn't have swimming pool but Waikiki beach is only 5 mins though it's really congested.I noticed that a bed lined was not changed to new one. It was pretty disappointed. There were only soap and shower cap in the bathroom. It's good real hotel if you just stay for sleep.
Reviews.Author: footygirl35

Reviews.Content: Very good 2 star I stayed at the Ewa for nearly 4 weeks. It is a 2 star hotel and therefore cheaper than most, but is quite comfortable and certainly adequate. The staff are friendly, it is clean, and with the smallest kitchenette I have ever seen (in my room), allows you to save by not buying out all the time. It does show its age however, and the owners are slowly updating things like the carpets, beds, etc. If you don't want to pay high prices, and want to be very close to Hawaii beach, I can recommend the EWA.
Reviews.Author: LG-World-Traveller

Reviews.Content: Good location I choosed this hotel based on other reviews about its good location and price. For much less of the price some nearby hotels charged, this hotel provided an average service in a very good location.This is not a luxury property and it shows signs of time, but the room was comfortable (with buildings blocking any natural view). As I intended to spend very few time at the hotel, I found it OK to the pay what I did for it. No breakfast, but there were a number of options around (nothing memorable).Waikiki beach is located 3 blocks from the the hotel, and if you like to shop around there are plenty of souvenirs and clothing stores very close.Luis M., Caracas-Venezuela
Reviews.Author: mixtli
